pullRequest.body:
Given a group `G` acting on the ring `k`, provide the `G`-action over the `k`-affine bases of a `k`-module `V`.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

This could be generalised using some `IsScalarTower` conditions but I'm a bit lazy to sort out exactly what those are and what API we are missing.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [feee1d67b9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14863/commits/feee1d67b9698632ae6d192abf058ddbdf6a7786)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ affineIndependent_smul`
`+ basisOf_smul`
`+ coord_smul`
`+ direction_smul`
`+ instMulAction`
`+ instSMul`
`+ instance [SMul G G'] [IsScalarTower G G' V] : IsScalarTower G G' (AffineBasis ι k V)`
`+ instance [SMulCommClass G G' V] : SMulCommClass G G' (AffineBasis ι k V)`
`+ mulAction`
`+ pointwiseSMul`
`+ pointwiseVAdd`
`+ reindex_smul`
`+ smul_bot`
`+ smul_eq_map`
`+ smul_mem_smul_iff`
`+ smul_mem_smul_iff_of_isUnit`
`+ smul_mem_smul_iff₀`
`+ smul_span`
`+ smul_top`
`+ weightedVSubOfPoint_smul`
`+ weightedVSub_smul`
`+ ⟨AffineIndependent.of_smul,`
`++ coe_smul`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10366766671/job/28696757821)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10366766671/job/28696757234)

bors d+

Please fix the PR description before merging, it no longer reflects the state of the PR

bors d+

Please fix the PR description before merging, it no longer reflects the state of the PR
Does this generalize to any group action on `k`?
Yes
Can you add some lemmas about the other basic operations too, like we did for vadd?
The ones I don't have here are the ones I failed to prove. Feel free to add them yourself though
Now that we have #14945, let's add a lemma about `basisOf` too, and perhaps `coord` or whatever else we did for `vadd`.
I added a TODO here, but I guess it applies to all of these actions?
Yes, I think so
Could you copy the `TODO` to the other new instances, where appropriate?
I think I did that correctly, but it's 3am here so you might want to double check
Shouldn't this be `direction_smul` (and `simp`?)

```suggestion
lemma smul_affineSpan (a : M) (s : Set V) : a • affineSpan k s = affineSpan k (a • s) := map_span _ s
```
(unless there is precedent otherwise)
Sadly, there is precedent here: `AffineSubspace.span_union`. I would like to clean things up but I already have too many things on my plate
I think elsewhere we state this kind of thing separately for `Group` and `IsUnit`? (proving the latter from the former)
Well actually all the examples that come to mind only have a `Group` and `GroupWithZero` versions, and are missing the `IsUnit` version? eg `Set.smul_mem_smul_set_iff`/`Set.smul_mem_smul_set_iff₀`
It might be worth being consistent here, especially if you don't care about the `IsUnit` case. Alternatively, perhaps leave a TODO about copying this generality back to the other lemmas?
Done
Can this one be generalized easily to `G` instead of `kˣ`, as we did elsewhere?

```suggestion
end Field
```
Is this one also `G`-generalizable?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Scaling of affine bases
